title: [axel] [Compilation failure] An error is reported when the Spack is used to install axel in Ubuntu18.
body:
<!-- Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve.
Example: "I ran `spack find` to list all the installed packages and ..." -->
Hello,I meet a question about an error is reported when the Spack is used to install axel in Ubuntu18.
### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
root@ubuntu:~#spack install --keep-stage axel 
……
==> axel: Executing phase: 'build'
==> [2020-12-28-10:13:11.011226] 'make' '-j16'
make  all-recursive
make[1]: Entering directory '/home/spack-stage/root/spack-stage-axel-2.16.1-jdoc6agvihvicnxo3vxmvmzw62luefw5/spack-src'
Making all in src
make[2]: Entering directory '/home/spack-stage/root/spack-stage-axel-2.16.1-jdoc6agvihvicnxo3vxmvmzw62luefw5/spack-src/src'
  CC       conf.o
  CC       axel.o
  CC       conn.o
  CC       ftp.o
  CC       http.o
  CC       search.o
  CC       ssl.o
  CC       tcp.o
  CC       text.o
  CCLD     axel
text.o: In function `print_help':
/home/spack-stage/root/spack-stage-axel-2.16.1-jdoc6agvihvicnxo3vxmvmzw62luefw5/spack-src/src/text.c:673: undefined reference to `libintl_gettext'
text.o: In function `print_alternate_output':
/home/spack-stage/root/spack-stage-axel-2.16.1-jdoc6agvihvicnxo3vxmvmzw62luefw5/spack-src/src/text.c:587: undefined reference to `libintl_gettext'
text.o: In function `main':
/home/spack-stage/root/spack-stage-axel-2.16.1-jdoc6agvihvicnxo3vxmvmzw62luefw5/spack-src/src/text.c:107: undefined reference to `libintl_bindtextdomain'
/home/spack-stage/root/spack-stage-axel-2.16.1-jdoc6agvihvicnxo3vxmvmzw62luefw5/spack-src/src/text.c:108: undefined reference to `libintl_textdomain'
text.o: In function `print_version':
/home/spack-stage/root/spack-stage-axel-2.16.1-jdoc6agvihvicnxo3vxmvmzw62luefw5/spack-src/src/text.c:701: undefined reference to `libintl_gettext'
/home/spack-stage/root/spack-stage-axel-2.16.1-jdoc6agvihvicnxo3vxmvmzw62luefw5/spack-src/src/text.c:702: undefined reference to `libintl_gettext'
/home/spack-stage/root/spack-stage-axel-2.16.1-jdoc6agvihvicnxo3vxmvmzw62luefw5/spack-src/src/text.c:702: undefined reference to `libintl_gettext'
text.o: In function `main':
/home/spack-stage/root/spack-stage-axel-2.16.1-jdoc6agvihvicnxo3vxmvmzw62luefw5/spack-src/src/text.c:204: undefined reference to `libintl_gettext'
/home/spack-stage/root/spack-stage-axel-2.16.1-jdoc6agvihvicnxo3vxmvmzw62luefw5/spack-src/src/text.c:261: undefined reference to `libintl_gettext'
text.o:/home/spack-stage/root/spack-stage-axel-2.16.1-jdoc6agvihvicnxo3vxmvmzw62luefw5/spack-src/src/text.c:247: more undefined references to `libintl_gettext' follow
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
Makefile:393: recipe for target 'axel' failed
make[2]: *** [axel] Error 1
make[2]: Leaving directory '/home/spack-stage/root/spack-stage-axel-2.16.1-jdoc6agvihvicnxo3vxmvmzw62luefw5/spack-src/src'
Makefile:482: recipe for target 'all-recursive' failed
make[1]: *** [all-recursive] Error 1
make[1]: Leaving directory '/home/spack-stage/root/spack-stage-axel-2.16.1-jdoc6agvihvicnxo3vxmvmzw62luefw5/spack-src'
Makefile:379: recipe for target 'all' failed
make: *** [all] Error 2
```
I have found that the **libintl** link library is located incorrectly due to the Ubuntu compiler problem. As a result, the **libintl** link library does not work.But I'm not sure if this is the right thing to do, it's the compiler's problem.As my solution is as follows：
```console
root@ubuntu:~#spack edit axel
diff --git a/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/axel/package.py b/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/axel/package.py
index 0c68680a2d..79776ac33c 100644
--- a/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/axel/package.py
+++ b/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/axel/package.py
@@ -22,6 +22,10 @@ class Axel(AutotoolsPackage):
     depends_on('gettext')
     depends_on('openssl')
 
+    def configure_args(self):
+        args = ['LIBS=-lintl']
+        return args
+
     def autoreconf(self, spec, prefix):
         bash = which('bash')
         bash('./autogen.sh')
root@ubuntu:~#spack install --keep-stage axel 
……
==> No binary for axel-2.16.1-6u5hwh6weiw6ciec2jyjearfb7iwom4d found: installing from source
==> Using cached archive: /home/spack/var/spack/cache/_source-cache/archive/64/64529add74df3db828f704b42d4ec3fcdacb8142c84f051f9213637c337e706c.tar.gz
==> axel: Executing phase: 'autoreconf'
==> axel: Executing phase: 'configure'
==> axel: Executing phase: 'build'
==> axel: Executing phase: 'install'
[+] /home/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu18.04-aarch64/gcc-10.2.0/axel-2.16.1-6u5hwh6weiw6ciec2jyjearfb7iwom4d
==> axel: Successfully installed axel-2.16.1-6u5hwh6weiw6ciec2jyjearfb7iwom4d
```
Summary: Use the LIBS parameter to add **-lintl** to the end of the link library.As shown in the following configuration file, this is why I use the method above：
```console
axel$(EXEEXT): $(axel_OBJECTS) @(axel_DEPENDENCIES) $(EXTRA_axel_DEPENDENCIES) 
              @rm -f axel$(EXEEXT)
               $(AM_V_CCLD) $(LINK) $(axel_OBJECTS) $(axel_LDADD) $(LIBS)
```
This method can solve the problem. In package.py, add "-lintl" to the end of the link library by using the LIBS parameter. I'm not sure whether this will cause unpredictable consequences. Can you help us find a better solution?

### Information on your system
root@ubuntu:~# spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.16.0-77-98460b6f4
* **Python:** 3.6.9
* **Platform:** linux-ubuntu18.04-aarch64
* **Concretizer:** original
